title: Publications and Media
text:
arXiv Preprint | Code
Over the centuries, I have devoted countless hours to deciphering and translating the ancient scripts and dialects of the various peoples of Middle-earth. My goal is to gain a deeper understanding of the cultures and histories of these peoples by studying their languages. Currently, I am working on a monograph that explores the linguistic roots of the Elvish languages. Through extensive research and analysis, I hope to shed light on the connections between the different dialects of Elvish and their origins. This project has been particularly challenging, as Elvish is a complex and nuanced language, but I am determined to see it through to completion.

title: Publications and Media
section: The History of the War of the Ring
text:
The History of the War of the Ring

arXiv Preprint | Code
I am creating a comprehensive and detailed history of the conflict that goes beyond the surface-level events. By gathering information from a variety of sources, including my own memories, written accounts, and oral histories, I hope to shed new light on this important period in Middle-earth’s history and provide valuable insights into the motivations and actions of the various players involved.

title: You can’t live a full life on an empty stomach.
text:
LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




You can’t live a full life on an empty stomach.
Welcome! I am Allison Thirion Blasius, MPH, RD, LD, FAND, a registered dietitian and doctoral student.
I have been a Registered Dietitian since 2018 and have practiced in a variety of pediatric settings, including eating disorders, neurology, surgery, pulmonolgy, general outpatient counseling, school nutrition. Currently, I practice at UH Rainbow Babies and Children’s Hospital and sub-specailize in both pediatric endocrinology and pediatric kidney disease. I also work with Camp Ho Mita Koda, the nation’s oldest camp for children with type 1 diabetes.
My research interests center around nutritional quality of life in children, especially those with chronic conditions like type 1 diabetes and end-stage renal disease. I am also interested in the impact that public health nutrition programs like the National School Lunch Program (NSLP) have on childhood health outcomes and how policies dictating these programs can be optimized to promote the long-term health of all children. Currently, I work under the mentorship of Dr. Melissa Prescott on a variety of projects regarding diet quality, nutrition education, and NLSP policy.
While I enjoy research, education is my passion. I have been an adjunct lecturer at Case Western Reserve University since 2023, where I teach introductory nutrition courses at the undergraduate level. I also support the UH Dietetic Internship as part of my clinical role and have precepted over 75 students since becoming an RD.
Almost everything you need to know about me professionally can be found on my CV.
Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.

title: The Study Buddies
text:
As a wizard and scholar of Middle-earth, I have been studying the magic of the natural world for centuries. Through my self-portraits, I aim to capture the essence of my own being and reflect on my own journey through time. Each photograph is a reflection of my own experiences and emotions. Through my photography, I hope to offer a glimpse into my life as a scholar and adventurer, and inspire others to reflect on their own journeys through the world.
